The Council is keen to maximise the community benefit for every pound awarded, and with this in mind has embarked upon a detailed review of how grant funding is dispensed, ranging from the overarching strategy and work streams to detailed work on the processes of provider sel
contracts.cpv_description: Provision of services to the community

contracts.title: Provision of Vehicles and Vehicle Maintenance Services - Soft Market Test
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is keen to explore options for the future provision and maintenance of the Council's vehicle fleet (currently 58 vehicles including a number of refuse collection vehicles).  The Council requires a professionally operated service that can provide an excellent vehicle management service.
The Council provides a wide range of frontline services including street cleansing, grounds maintenance, the collection of refuse and recycling material. In continuing to prov
contracts.cpv_description: Motor vehicles and Specialist vehicles and Repair, maintenance and associated services of vehicles and related equipment

contracts.title: Tree Maintenance Services
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is seeking expressions of interest from applicants who are interested in providing Tree Maintenance Services for the Borough.
The type of work the Council will be seeking is works to Trees in public areas and will include
General Tree Pruning
Crown Raising and Reductions
Tree clearance/ Thinning
Removal of trees in a controlled manner in plantations.
Stump Grinding/ Treatment
Any other Tree Maintenance Service
The Contractor will also be expected to provid
contracts.cpv_description: Tree-maintenance services

contracts.title: CCTV Maintenance Contract
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council is seeking a contractor for the Reactive and Proactive Maintenance of Public Space CCTV cameras, the CCTV Monitoring Suite, transmission equipment and all other technical equipment that underpins the system. The contract period will be 3 years commencing on 1 October 2019, with an option to extend for up to an additional 2 years. The Council's CCTV system currently comprises 106 individual image streams. The CCTV system comprises: • 71 360 Vision PTZ ana
contracts.cpv_description: Surveillance and security systems and devices and Repair and maintenance services

contracts.title: Banking Services and Merchant Acquiring Services
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is undertaking a review of its current banking and merchant acquiring arrangements and is inviting potential service providers to tender for new contracts to commence as follows:

	Banking: April 1st, 2019.
	Merchant Acquiring: no later than November 19th, 2018

The tender is divided into two Lots. The Council is willing to consider bids from separate suppliers of banking and merchant acquiring services and tenderers are invited to bid for either or both of
contracts.cpv_description: Banking services and Financial transaction processing and clearing-house services

contracts.title: Provision of a Sustainable Organisation Review and Associated Consultancy Services
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council proposes to undertake a Sustainable Organisation Review, the purpose of which is to reappraise fundamentally the Council's operating model, and to identify opportunities for further income generation and efficiencies across all services - General Services (GRA) and our Council Housing stock (HRA) - with the aim of ensuring that the Council can deliver its vision, key priorities, and maintain service provision and financial sustainability beyond 2020/21.which
contracts.cpv_description: Business and management consultancy and related services

contracts.title: Provision of Responsive Repairs, Works to Voids, Gas Servicing and Maintenance
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council (WLBC) owns and manages almost 6,000 residential properties across the West Lancashire area. WLBC is looking to procure a single contract for the provision of responsive repairs to properties, works to void properties, the servicing and maintenance of gas installations and central heating systems, electrical testing and specified cyclical maintenance. WLBC will in due course issue a Contract Notice inviting Contractors to register their interest in this procuremen
contracts.cpv_description: Repair and maintenance services of building installations

contracts.title: Sustainable Organisation Review: Soft Market Test
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council proposes to undertake a Sustainable Organisation Review ('Review'), the purpose of which will be to reappraise fundamentally the Council's operating model, and to identify opportunities for further income generation and efficiencies across all services.  The aim of the Review is to ensure that the Council can deliver its vision ('To be a Council which is ambitious for West Lancashire - our Economy, Environment and for Health and Wellbeing'
contracts.cpv_description: Business and management consultancy and related services

contracts.title: Stray Dogs: Collection ,Transport and Kennelling
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council is considering tendering a contract in relation to the Collection, Transport and Kennelling of Stray Dogs and invites expressions of interest from interested organisations by the date and in the format specified at the end of this advertisement. This contract will be offered to enable West Lancashire Borough Council to comply with its legal responsibilities to control stray dogs. As such, the Council is seeking a contractor to: respond to communications regarding
contracts.cpv_description: Dog kennel services

contracts.title: Catering Concession Contract: Chapel Gallery Ormskirk
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is seeking expressions of interest regarding the provision of a café / bistro facility at its newly refurbished Chapel Gallery, prior to a formal tendering process. This will be a concession contract and the expectation is that the Council will receive an annual income from the successful contractor. It is the Council's intention to award a contract of up to 5 years.  

Interested parties are encouraged to attend an open session being held at 14.00 o
contracts.cpv_description: Canteen and catering services

contracts.title: Resin bound gravel feature: remedial works
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council is seeking expressions of interest from firms with expertise in the laying of resin bound gravel surfaces, in advance of requesting quotations for remedial works to the 'Flaxton Rainbow', Skelmersdale, Lancashire WN8 6PE.  The works will involve the preparation of the surface and laying of resin bound gravel in similar colours to the present surface with non-slip finishes (see photo attached).  Please register your interest only if you have experience of
contracts.cpv_description: Flatwork for recreation installations and Repair work on recreational areas and Repair and maintenance services of building installations

contracts.title: Leisure Facilities Replacements and Improvements in Skelmersdale, Ormskirk and Burscough
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council has several leisure facilities across the Borough which are delivered through West Lancashire Community Leisure Trust and managed by Serco under a contract which is due to end on 31 March 2020.  The Council and the West Lancashire Clinical Commissioning Group are exploring partnership opportunities to develop two co-located facilities in the towns of Skelmersdale and Ormskirk.  The aim of the partnership will be to replace the two ageing 1970s swimming pools with
contracts.cpv_description: Construction work of leisure facilities and Leisure centre construction work

contracts.title: Cleaning Services for West Lancashire Investment Centre
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council invites tenders for the provision of a cleaning service at the West Lancashire Investment Centre, Whitemoss Business park Skelmersdale.
The Investment Centre houses many different private companies over two floors. There are also five conference / meeting rooms and a café facility.
contracts.cpv_description: Building-cleaning services

contracts.title: Security and Concierge Service
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is seeking to tender its contract for security and concierge services at the West Lancashire Investment Centre, Skelmersdale.
The Investment Centre is a fully-serviced, 2-storey office complex located at White Moss Business Park next to junction 4 of the M58, just over 4 miles from the M6.  It comprises approximately 40 office suites, 6 conference/meeting rooms and an on–site business café.  The building offers tenant access 24/7 and currently houses around 300 p
contracts.cpv_description: Security services and Guard services

contracts.title: Options Appraisal for the Formation of a Development Company or Companies
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council invites tenders for the provision of a detailed appraisal of the options available, including but not limited to the establishment of a Development Company or Companies or hybrid structure(s), designed to achieve the objectives summarised below. 

The Council has experience of small- and medium-scale development for both commercial and residential purposes and wishes to explore the options for undertaking greater work in these areas to support the Council's
contracts.cpv_description: Financial consultancy services and Legal advisory and information services and General management consultancy services and Financial management consultancy services and Evaluation consultancy services

contracts.title: Demolition of properties at Beechtrees, Skelmersdale
contracts.description: Tenders are sought for the full demolition of 52 no. properties at Beechtrees, Skelmersdale, Lancashire.  The properties are owned by West Lancashire Borough Council and consist of a mixture of residential flats and houses of 2 and 3 storeys. They are of non-traditional construction, the type being a Reema Conclad system.  Remedial works to retained terrace gables are required.   The works are intended to commence on site in September 2017, with a provisional completion date of November 2017.  T
contracts.cpv_description: Building demolition and wrecking work and earthmoving work

contracts.title: Invasive Species Control Services
contracts.description: West Lancashire Borough Council invites tenders for the periodic treatment of two invasive species of plant on council land: Japanese Knotweed and Giant Hogweed. Outbreaks have already been surveyed, mapped and prioritized into three phases. The treatment regime lasts three years for each phase. Phases commence over three consecutive years. Full details including maps are included in the tender documents. This is a three year contract with options to extend by up to two additional years.  TENDER
contracts.cpv_description: Weed-clearance services and Weed-killing services

contracts.title: Inspection of Hackney Carriages and Private Hire Vehicles
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council invites tenders for the inspection of Hackney Carriages and Private Hire vehicles in accordance with the details contained in the Contract.
 The majority of Hackney Carriages and Private Hire vehicles are operated from Skelmersdale and Ormskirk/Burscough. Therefore, the Council is seeking to appoint one Garage Owner whose Garage Site proposed for this contract is in the Skelmersdale area and another Garage Owner whose Garage Site proposed for this contract is in
contracts.cpv_description: Repair, maintenance and associated services of vehicles and related equipment

contracts.title: Financial Viability and Funding Options Appraisal for Replacement Swimming Pool/Leisure Facilities
contracts.cpv_description: Financial consultancy services and Business and management consultancy and related services and Sporting services

contracts.title: Development Partner: Moor Street Gateway Project
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is seeking to appoint a development partner to design and build a town centre mixed use scheme including the provision of a new, fit for purpose, modern, bus station facility, and uses that contribute to the wider regeneration of Ormskirk Town Centre.  The scheme must provide:

•             At least 900sqm of ‘shell and core’ floor space at ground floor for use by the Council
•             A bus apron area to include at least 5 bus stands and bus movement area
contracts.cpv_description: Works for complete or part construction and civil engineering work and Real estate services

contracts.title: Funding of additional affordable rented accommodation in West Lancashire
contracts.description:
West Lancashire Borough Council is keen to increase the supply of affordable housing in the Borough, and is seeking to establish the potential interest from the market in the provision of public or private funding to support the delivery of additional affordable rented accommodation.
The Council currently retains capital receipts from Council properties which are sold through Right to Buy arrangements. Retained capital receipts must be used to increase the supply of affordable rented housing. T
contracts.cpv_description: Financial and insurance services
